@Zhikui Ren - I tried moving the base class variables to the initialization list, but could not get it to compile.  Do you have any suggestions on how I can fix this?

Adding this line "PresenceSensor(iSensorType, iSensorName) :" gives the following error:
PresenceSensor.cpp:27:44: error: no matching function for call to 'boost::asio::posix::basic_stream_descriptor<>::basic_stream_descriptor()'
|    27 |     PresenceSensor(iSensorType, iSensorName) :
|       |                                            ^

I assume that is referring to the derived class boost::asio::io_context parameter,but I do already have that in the initialization list: gpioFd(io)

> "PresenceSensor(iSensorType, iSensorName) :" 
It should not be colon here, but a comma, please check other example like
https://github.com/openbmc/dbus-sensors/blob/master/src/TachSensor.cpp#L53
Acknowledged
I think the idea is to separate refactor into a separate review, i.e. keep the same functionality. Please leave the additional functionality into a follow up review.
Ok. This does retain same functionality, but I can remove the polling from this commit and put in back in the other commit.
Done
Looking good for the refactor. Only one minor thing, please see inline comment
This is not needed. It is the same as base class
Done
this is not needed
Done
Destructor is marked as pure virtual in header but defined as default here. There is destructor in EventPresenceSensor so shouldn't this is pure virtual only ?
Done
I think if gpioLine.event_get_fd fails then we have unusable EventPrenceSensor. object. It will be better to throw exception rather than continuing with improper object and fail later.
Done
I think this constructor is not needed. Can you please tell if there was any reason for keeping default constructor.
Done

since gpioLine is member of PresenceSensor shouldn't it's destruction should be taken by same class too. Here we are putting mandate for every child class of PresenceSensor to release for something that belongs to parent class.
Done
This class's object will have to take care of copy constructor and copy assignment operator, Rule of three. https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/rule_of_three

Isn't that only required if there are pointers or that the default copy/assignment operators would not work? If so, looks like I would need to save the other args that were not saved in the object to user in the assignment.
Made base class noncopyable
Please add tested section

Looks like you were looking at prior patch set.  Comment was added in patch set 11, but I am unable to test as we dont have hardware that supports event driven gpio. It is just supposed to be a refactor (moving from TachSensor to its own file).
This seems to be conflict with https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/69897/10/src/PresenceSensor.hpp#13
NM - This is destructor.
nit: sensor is repeated here, type and name can be sufficient

This was to differentiate the sensor name from the GPIO pin name (see Event constructor)
  presenceSensor = std::make_shared<PollingPresenceSensor>("Fan", sensorName, *pinName, inverted, io);
ACK
Please see why build failed

I think this is now need to be rebased with https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/72833 so presence sensor can be shared by multiple fans and there is no need to use shared_ptr for gpioLine
shared_ptr for gpioLine  in https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/73043 is not needed anymore
